Reviews.Title: Awesome Price for a Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mandy Payne "Is it just me?"
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I am not terribly techy.  I can barely turn on the TV anymore.  So please, read the specs on this because I can't explain what they mean anyway.  This review is based solely on my experience with the camera.We took this great little camera on a trip to Mexico not long ago and it was awesome.  So easy to use that even I managed to get some spectacular photos.  My eyes are over 40 years old (the rest of me feels 29) so I have some trouble seeing up close.  Therefore, the pictures I took with this camera were kind of just point, shoot and pray.  Well the prayers were answered because when we looked at the pictures later on a screen I could actually see, they turned out super crisp.  In fact there was a topless sunbather in one that I hadn't seen and my son was delighted that I got such a sharp, focused shot!  Ha.The HD video is also super cool.  My son is using it to launch his youtube career -- he really needs to focus on college. -- lousy content aside, the videos turn out great.  I haven't used it for video, but he does and loves it.This camera is really sturdy and well made.  It bounced around in my bag, got knocked off the table a time or two, and overall wasn't treated as well as it should have been.  It didn't miss a beat or even get a scratch.The zoom is amazing.  The display is great (or so I am told since I can't really see it).  This is an all around great addition to the amateur photographer or as a basic family camera.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Nikon L830 Great Camera....No Zoom Noise whilre Recording Video, Fantastic Purchase...Better on sale......
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Perry
Reviews.Content: Nikon L830 DOES NOT HAVE ANY ZOOM NOISE WHILE FILMING A VIDEO. It's easy to use in auto mode or has plenty of settings for the novis/hobbist that doesn't want to invest a couple of grand in lense's and bodies.  My fujifilm S8200 had terrible zoom noise. That's why I took it back!This camera has far superior clarity in still pictures compared to the Fujifilm S8200 and when filming in HD, this camera has no interlacing issues when moving the camera like the Fujifilm S8200. I like the ability of just buying AA batteries and not being tied down to a lithium battery pack. I like the RED body although it shows fingerprints more than a black camera....no biggies! I've never used a View FInder so I don't miss that.  I am on the fence about the settings buttons and not having a rotating selector switch.  I do like having the saturation button at my fintertips though so maybe i'm really not on the fence.I do have only 1 issue.  On my old Fujifilm S700, the flash auto popped up when needed. The L830 has to be manually released to function, but knowing that.....I just release it most of the time.MSRP was $299, Sale was $269 and Got it from Walmart for $229, I think she quoted me the wrong price over the phone and had to get a manager override to give me the quoted $229.I'm using a 32Gig Class 10 SanDisk HC Ultra Memory card from Best Buy for $24 and it will allow me to take over 3000 photos.  I think I should have went with a 8Gig SanDisk Ultra PLUS  that had a faster transfer rate.  I think I'd do more research on the SDHC Cards before I buy one.

Reviews.Title: Very Amateur Photographer
Reviews.Author: Bohemian Girl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel quite a bit. I wanted a camera I could be comfortable with, not spend too much time setting up my shots, and still get a great picture in the end.My last camera was a Canon power shot. After my grand daughter dropped and broke the lens and telescope, I put it away and just used my phone for the past year. We leave for my nieces wedding in Ireland in August. I want to make sure I get tons of great pictures. I want to take classes and become a better photographer. So based on the previous reviewers who give their pros and cons, thank you so much.I like the weight and feel of my camera. I like the ease of selecting the shooting mode, switching between the various menus, and the playback mode is similar to my old Canon. I also like the lens cover. It is like a little magnet gadget and has a tiny cord that holds the cap while it is off the lens. I lost so many lens caps in the past:{One tiny thing I am not crazy about: having to pop up the flash. I rather liked the old lazy way of the auto flash happening when I needed it.I am going to work on my picture taking skills, and report back to you after I know what I'm supposed to do with all these bells a whistles. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera
Reviews.Author: Ms. S. Ryan "Druid"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix l830 is awesome, we have been having fun with this camera. It takes great night pictures and video, still checking all the extras out. So far this is worth every penny we spent on it. I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: AMAZON.COM LIKELY THINKS I'VE GONE STARK RAVING BONKERS - I GOT THIS & THREE OTHER CAMERAS IN A WEEKS TIME!
Reviews.Author: THE AUTISTIC WEREWOLF "Wolf"
Reviews.Content: I have been buying up the best cameras that still use AA batteries because; I have cerebral palsy and do not drive.  People who drive think nothing of motoring over to the nearest photo store to get their camera's specialty brand specific sometimes even model specific battery.  Being disabled I can not drive, trust me I tried driving and lets say everyone in Maryland breathed a sigh of relief when I renewed my MTA Maryland Disability Transportation Card.  You see I never want to be caught without batteriesif ever I am in the right place at the right time with my camera at the ready.  Being disabled I do not have the luxury of being able to pop round the the Ye Olde Photo Shoppe for a bracing battery refill.However I did not want just any camera that used AA Battery power.  I wanted a camera that took awesome pictures and this new Nikon Coolpix L830 does that with ease.  This Nikon Coolpix L830 takes four AA batteries so it is a bit of a battery hog but, I feel the batteries last longer.  You would think the batteries weigh the camera down but nope, this camera is small and light.  Other reviews suggest thie Nikon Coolpix L830 suffers in build quality well that bug must have been fixed.  There was NOTHING at all the least bit loose on my new Nikon Coolpix L830.  I got the red camera and I saw finger prints mine of course, but that does not bother me.  Opening the battery door is a real beast until you get the hang of it.  A better battery door solution is definitely needed for this camera period, I'd take off half a star on my rating if I could.I am just learning how to master the Fstops and understand ISO and how it can be manipulated to improve picture quality.  For the longest time I just set the camera at auto and hoped for the best. This Nikon Coolpix L830 and a new Canon I got were so simple and easy to understand it was almost as if the controls invited me to experiment.  This Nikon Coolpix L830 is so small that my small hands and long cerebral palsied fingers can dance around the camera controls with relative ease.  Once I saw how changing a few of the settings in manual mode resulted in much better pictures than one dare hope for in auto mode I was hooked, like a kid in a candy store,I live in a huge somewhat beautiful building that simply begs to have its picture taken and this weekend I did.  Towson, Maryland is home to some of the most unique buildings some consider perfectly ugly.  This weekend I pictures of my my neighborhood showcasing the best and worse of the Towson, Maryland skyline.  I was not sure I was going to stay out and take lots of pictures so I had only the batteries in my Nikon Coolpix L830.  I took well over 400 pictures with 4 Duracell copper top batteries very few with flash since the sun was  My 6 foot 8 in 300 pound brother goes with me when I take pictures outside, he makes sure no one bothers me.  My brother also blocks out the sun when I want a shot of something small in the shade.  The camera has some noise in low light but the camera can be adjusted to eliminate much of the noise.The Nikon Coolpix L830 zoom is awesome BUT I would use it only with a very stable tripod.  Let's face it the natural shaking of my cerebral palsy does not bode well for any pictures I take using the zoom feature unassisted by a tripod.  The pop up flash is good for objects close by and for general utility pictures but if you want to set a mood or construct a visual experience you will need dedicated lighting.  Remember to pop up your flash the camera seems to compensate better for issues in a shot when you remember to pop up the flash.  The Nikon Coolpix L830 is no where near as noisey as my Pentax K5 or K30 even if they take batter pictures.  The Nikon Coolpix L830 does not exactly slip into a shirt pocket but it can be completely concealed in one of my big brothers massive hands. I wouldnot suggest the Nikon Coolpix L830 for guys with massive or even large hands since everything is tightly packed onto the camera.  My brother can use my Nikon Coolpix L830 and even likes it but he struggles like a gaint trying to change the a new borns diaper.I am NOT a professional protographer.  I am not even an avid photo-bug.  I am just a disabled dude who is fascinated with the art of taking pictures that appeal to me.  I love this Nikon Coolpix L830 because; the more I learn about it the more it becomes an extention of my imagineation.  I am just a beginner in the world of photographn but this Nikon Coolpix L830 makes me feel like a photographer with ideas far beyond my novice station.

Reviews.Title: Killer Camera with Amazing Battery Life
Reviews.Author: Milamber "Milamber"
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this camera.  I've seen much more expensive cameras that deliver a fraction of this camera's abilities and aren't as easy to use.  I think the one most important issue I've noticed is for all its power, the batteries seem to last forever.  I've had similar cameras and for the amount of photos I've taken I would have gone through 2-3 battery changes, and I'm still on the first set of batteries!

Reviews.Title: The zoom is fantastic!!
Reviews.Author: Brenda Prezell
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera because of its zoom. I didn't want all the different lenses to mess with. It's a good camera for amatures. I think it will give me some great close up actions shots this summer on the lake!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome photos, a couple of reservations
Reviews.Author: Peggy P.A.
Reviews.Content: I've taken this camera on two trips- one to Arizona, and one to France.  I was absolutely bowled over by the quality of the photographs.  They are crisp and clear, and the color is beautiful.  The zoom is fabulous, and most of the time, I didn't have problems with blurry zoomed photos.  Even in low light, I never had to use a flash.  In Arizona, I took lots of photos at an outdoor Chihuly exhibit in the Arizona Botanical Garden, both in the afternoon and early evening light.  It was fun experimenting with the different scene modes at dusk.  Also took lots of night shots in France, and they were also great.  Some have complained of battery life, but I found them to last a really long time.  I never changed batteries for the whole week in Arizona, and then added another couple of days of battery life in France, and those were with the batteries that came with the camera.  I had purchased rechargeables, and they lasted the rest of the two weeks in France, with power to spare.My reservations-  Hate not having a viewfinder.  If the photos weren't so great, I would have seriously thought about returning it.  Seriously Nikon?  Put a viewfinder in this camera and it would get 10 stars.Also, the door for the batteries and SD card feels a little flimsy.  Opening it is not too difficult, but the closing mechanism is a little awkward.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera, but I returned for a Panasonic w/ viewfinder.
Reviews.Author: Gramma Denise
Reviews.Content: I loved the size, and feel of this Nikon. The zoom was great, the pictures sharp and the price, very good.  And, I liked the Nikon's tilted screen.  However, this was my first camera without a viewfinder, and after two weeks, I returned it and ordered the Panasonic Lumix FZ60 - a more expensive camera; but, with viewfinder. I really prefer having the  option of having both. The majority of my pictures are nature - birds, flowers, scenery. I had issues with seeing the screen in bright light and it's easier for me the zero in on the subject faster with the viewfinder. It is also easier for me to hold my camera steady when using the viewfinder.  The panasonic does not have as long a zoom, but it serves my purpose and cropping  the final picture brings my subjects in beautifully. The Panasonic pictures are awesome, it's easy to use and has some great editing features. Bottom line, manufactures are missing the boat by not having more options with optic viewfinders  in their comoact models.

Reviews.Title: Attention to detail lacking ..
Reviews.Author: Vikram Chhabra
Reviews.Content: First off, I am very happy with my purchase.I was looking for an easy/solid point and shoot, and the L830 came through.With a 2 year old, I want to capture as much as possible without having to worry about bulk and lenses. The photo and video quality is excellent.Two annoying things though (and I'm sure it was to cut down on cost. Give me a scroll wheel to go through images and setting and for God's sake give me a view finder. The LCD is great, but annoying as all heck in bright conditions.If you can get past those two things, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Terrific little camera
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth W. Paul "Betsy"
Reviews.Content: I doubt there is a better camera for the money.  I have had full size dslr and slr Nikons all my life.  Never a problem and they all produce excellent pictures.  I no longer take pictures professionally, so I looked into a light weight camera that at least had most of the bells and whistles.  This one fits the bill beautifully.  My only complaint would be no viewfinder.  Very hard to see the picture in bright sunlight.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Patton
Reviews.Content: i took this on a cruise and caught pic's of flying fish between the waves . I took shots of water propulsion system in action from 1/4 mile away and they all came out great

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever!
Reviews.Author: electra
Reviews.Content: I wanted something a little more sophisticated than a point and shoot and this camera is terrific. It is easy to use, easy to hold and the moveable viewfinder is great!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Brett D Montague
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera that takes high quality pictures quickly and easily.  Not a professional photographer and wanted something easy to use and this fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: Best camera in it's price range
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Rather than compare specifications, let me just say what I love about this camera.  It has a very fast auto-focus!  Way faster than either of my Panasonic Lumix cameras.  I thought I might miss a digital viewfinder but discovered that, with the brightness turned up on the LCD, the viewfinder was quite useable in bright sunlight and the view is stunning in hi resolution.  The dual controls for the telephoto are nicely placed and quite accessible.  I also find using AA batteries easier and less expensive than proprietary batteries.  I use alkaline and rechargeables and may use lithium in the future.  The L830 can use all three types.  This is a GREAT hybrid camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned!!
Reviews.Author: Karoni
Reviews.Content: I have been taking the best pictures EVER since I got this camera.  Tonight was the best of all - took a picture of the moon - you can see craters CLEARLY in the photo.  Amazing quality and so easy to use.  Not much of a learning curve at all for me, because I had a different Coolpix prior to this so it's similar.  When I share pics with my friends on Facebook they always want to know what kind of camera I used.

Reviews.Title: First digital camera.
Reviews.Author: fernando
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera and I think its awesome. I have been taking a lot of nice pictures and I'm improving every time. It is very easy to use and has a good zoom on it. the only thin I wish was different would be a battery pack instead of 4 AA batteries. (always keep an extra set.)

Reviews.Title: Good camera, recommend!
Reviews.Author: OCT
Reviews.Content: Nikon COOLPIX L830 16 MP CMOS Digital Camera is the greatest camera ever! I would like to recommend this camera to my friends!

Reviews.Title: Top notch
Reviews.Author: Nelle J
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for a novice like myself. The picture quality is sharp and crisp and my friends think it's the coolest thing ever since sliced bread. The only drawback is that it works with AA  batteries but they seem to last long. So far I love it.

Reviews.Title: This camera is great!
Reviews.Author: Richard Walker
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera in anticipation of a trip to Alaska,  we are thrilled with the ease of use and quality of the photos.We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for outdoors
Reviews.Author: LISANDRO CORDOBA
Reviews.Content: I wanted something to be not to small nor too big, and I think this camera is just what I was looking for. And well is a Nikon, the shots are extremely crisp and clear, very easy to use, specially in the auto mode. The zoom? WOW I was really impressed!! I can zoom in all the way and still capture a clear crisp shot of it.

Reviews.Title: Great pics and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Jim Curtis
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures. Very easy to use. Long battery life for still shots, short battery life for video. Does not come with an SD card, so you'll need to purchase one.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: berryd
Reviews.Content: Great camera, upgraded from my Nikon Coolpix S8100 when it crapped out.  Good telephoto and macro for internet,  and I am able to get photos of the dogs, so far I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L830
Reviews.Author: Ronald J. Ruiter
Reviews.Content: One of the features I love about this camera is all the special effects you can shoot pictures with. Plus the zoom is smooth and is great when trying to bring in that wildlife that is far off in the distance. I have found that the video is really great compared to an older video camera I had. The picture and sound are so much better. Plus here again, you can shoot your video with special effects. Great camera and so far I have no complaints on it at all. All of my photos have turned out great and it's so easy to use. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera but No Manual Mode
Reviews.Author: myria
Reviews.Content: AMAZING CAMERA!!!! I mainly bought the camera for its zoom and it hasn't failed me yet. Crisp pictures, easy to you use, and the battery life is the best I've come by. Its does really well in low light also. The only problems I've run into is I didn't realize there was no manual mode, and when its at its highest zoom it make a beeping nose( does not interfere with video). Other wise this is an amazing camera.

Reviews.Title: Great pics!
Reviews.Author: scnm
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Nice pics! Zoom works great and is able to focus quickly. Used at our daughters graduation outdoors. Not able to sit close. Got great pics with the zoom.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for.
Reviews.Author: Daisy
Reviews.Content: I was looking to replace my aging Kodak and decided on this camera after months of searching and reading online reviews. I plan on taking it on vacation so I will run it through the gauntlet then. So far it is doing exactly as advertised.Pros: Battery life seems fair, makes excellent pictures and is very user friendly. I started using it straight out of the box without having to read a book of instructions. It makes great low-light pictures, something that my old camera wasn't doing. Uses real batteries. Zoom brings the subject right to you.Cons: Action shots are blurry even with stable hands, no view finder. Doesn't feel real sturdy so I am still taking my older indestructible Kodak camera along in the rough places we ride which kind of defeats the purpose of replacing it.

Reviews.Title: Daughter's First  Camera
Reviews.Author: Alecia Polson
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased  for my  daughter for  fourteenth  birthday.  She  has shown  interest in photography  and wanted her "first real camera".  She has been enjoying  the functional ease  of it  and the nice pictures  it takes.  Camera looks nice  and the  zoom is  very nice.  She took a picture  of a deer in the woods.  Zoomed in to take a  nice still picture,  and the deer looks like it was standing right in front of her... picture clear.  It was nice!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Tom Cosellian
Reviews.Content: After using a Coolpix L110 for work I liked the ergonomics so I purchased the L830 for my personal use.  Not small and thats a good thing.  Beefy enough to hold comfortably in one hand and takes great pictures easy.  The zoom has an autofocus which truly does work.  I took closeups at a ballgame and razor sharp without a tripod.  The macro took great pictures of flowers and the detail was awesome.  I'm a Cannon man back in the day but Nikon has won me over.

Reviews.Title: Great in dark places and long distances
Reviews.Author: Tracy G. Conner
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a conference event. Got super pictures in low light with no flash. Zoom pictures up on stage came out clear and bright. The flash is a little overpowering so thought I'd put a screen on it. Most of my indoor shots were without flash and came out wonderfully. Love the 34x zoom, was like I was standing right next to my subject from across the auditiorium. Like that I can replace batteries immediately and don't have to wait and charge them. Feels good in your hand and easy to handle. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Tom Cosellian
Reviews.Content: After using a Coolpix L110 for work I liked the ergonomics so I purchased the L830 for my personal use.  Not small and thats a good thing.  Beefy enough to hold comfortably in one hand and takes great pictures easy.  The zoom has an autofocus which truly does work.  I took closeups at a ballgame and razor sharp without a tripod.  The macro took great pictures of flowers and the detail was awesome.  I'm a Cannon man back in the day but Nikon has won me over.

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY NIKON!
Reviews.Author: Motown53
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I've had Nikons before.  The viewer on the back Is a good 3 inches to view your subject but your photos also.  The zoom  brings the picture right to you. . It is light and easy to hold with one hand. Highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use and awesome close-ups
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Stypula "Kymm369"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for new camera that took nice close-ups of family as well as my crafts.  I was also looking for a camera to take non-flash pictures at events such as communions and dance recitals.  I have to say this camera has performed way beyond my expectations!  The resolution of the close-ups is fantastic and the zoom, non-flash shots are also fabulous...a great decision and purchase all the way around!  Oh and I love the deep red color..I know exactly which camera is mine in the group on the table!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: jink
Reviews.Content: Love the tilting screen and the pic quality is very nice.My wife loves the camera, it is a bit tricky with the flash but you can get use to it.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom camera!
Reviews.Author: John A Klimek
Reviews.Content: Great buy.  I was looking to buy a mid price all purpose zoom camera.  I was going to buy a Nikon s820.  I noted that the s830 was better rated on Amazon.  So we bought the s830.  We have had very good luck taking indoor pics in an auditorium.  Zoom works great, and pics are clear and vivid.  The indoor pics are not dark.  stabilization works great to reduce blur.  Some notes- get the class10 memory card.  Also stock up on GOOD rechargeable batteries such Duracell.  I have ac delco batts in the camera now.  They are working fine, but Duracells seem to be more predictable.  Don't use alkaline batteries.  They won't last...

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera, feels good and sturdy, takes excellent pictures.
Reviews.Author: Gidget
Reviews.Content: WOW! Best camera I have owned in a decade! The zoom is incredible, crisp clear images. Excellent purchase. I totally love the screen versatility.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Beverly Helms
Reviews.Content: Excellent.  Very happy with my purchase. Easy to operate and hold.Nice clear picture and great zoom capabilities. Would highly recommend getting one.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Henry J LaPointe "doglouie"
Reviews.Content: The camera was just what I was looking for.  The 34x Zoom works great, and is very to  operate.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Just What We Wanted
Reviews.Author: ZS2014
Reviews.Content: We ordered this as a gift for our son's graduation.  It is a larger camera (not pocket) size...but that was what we were looking for.  It's very easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Purchase
Reviews.Author: lynlyn
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for both photos and video recording. The results are exceptional, the videos are super clear and the audio is great. Photos are also beautiful. I have no regrets with this purchase. I haven't tried editing videos as yet, so I cannot comment on that, but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Inge Stein "Ingestein"
Reviews.Content: Awesome camara, and looks cute too.... Just shoot and click. Small enough to put in your handbag and works like a professional camera. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Annette Givens
Reviews.Content: Great camera no complaints. I recommend this for anyone who is looking for a simple camera. Get one today !

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Jan Klepinger
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera - for the price it's a good value! I have just started using it and so far, it is very user friendly. The only thing I don't like about it is that it doesn't have a viewfinder, which I don't remember seeing in the description at all. Other than that, it takes great photos and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L830
Reviews.Author: Mike Alvarado
Reviews.Content: For years I only used my pocket Sony Cyber - shot....It was time to upgrade.I love using the L830 its easy and I enjoy using the built in effects. The zoom is spectacular.I'm taking pictures like a pro these days. If only it could fit in my pocket.....I recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Victoria A.S.A Bellerose
Reviews.Content: Great camera takes good pictures . I like my camera. This was a good purchase.Easy to use. Good zoom I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Wrightn221
Reviews.Content: I took a couple of pictures with this came and they came out so beautiful! I'm still getting to know how it works, so it'll be awhile before I become a novice. Been taking pictures for over 30 years and needed to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Nothing but Awesome
Reviews.Author: Raye Lynn Snyder
Reviews.Content: There are still some features I have to use.  Took this camera on a trip and absolutely loved the use of it in the canyons and on my favorite trails.  No complaints whatsoever.  I'm not a professional but it sure feels close to being one for me.  Thanks for the input on the past gens that helped my purchase decision.  My dad has the previous gen.  THis camera is significantly more weight in the hand.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix L830
Reviews.Author: Rocky Johnson
Reviews.Content: Love the Nikon Coolpix l830. But can't seem to pick it up without pushing one of them silly bottoms.LOLIt really is a great camera.  Rocky

Reviews.Title: WOW!!!!
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Cruze Sr.
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a few days and am having a blast.  It's got so many features I haven't tried them all as yet.  It has 2 panorama modes, 180 degrees and 360 degrees and they're the best I've seen.  No stitching photos together, just click and hold the shutter button and turn.  When you've reached the end of your pan, just release the shutter button.  You get a beautiful pan shot.  I highly recommend this camera.  You cannot go wrong with a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: I Love My Nikon
Reviews.Author: Joseph Vilis
Reviews.Content: Love the T/W lens, the scene choices, etc. The tilt screen is great, it allows this senior to get shots that would be difficult otherwise. I had considered a D-SLR, however this camera is all I need, and then some.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kenneth A. Ensley
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera even though Ive only had it a short period of time. It replaced another Nikon which was also a good camera.

Reviews.Title: great gift
Reviews.Author: Bryan B.
Reviews.Content: my wife loves her camera - the pictures are of high quality and it was easy to use.  This is a bit thicker than the other digital cameras, but we knew that going in.  It fits in her purse and she loves the quality.

Reviews.Title: easy to/ use
Reviews.Author: Elaine Fagin
Reviews.Content: I am not a great or even good photographer, but part of my job involves taking photos and incorporating them into my journals. The zoom on this camera is amazing, the pictures I take using the 34x zoom are clear and crisp. I haven't had the camera for a very long so I am still learning about it, but the camera is easy to use and takes great pictures, which is what I bought the camera for.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Buzz Avery
Reviews.Content: Others have written plenty about the pros and cons.  The bulky size to accommodate the 4 AA batteries and lack of a viewfinder (a common complaint for most LCD cameras) cost this other great camera one star.

Reviews.Title: Fairly good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: OCGal "OCGal"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for a European trip because I did not want to lug around my large and heavy Canon 40D, and I wanted higher quality photos that can be achieved from a cell phone.I had a couple of issues with this camera. First of all, throw out the batteries that come with the camera.  Mine died after only 2 days.  I brought replacement batteries and they got me by for another week, and then those died too.  My Canon has spoiled me because that battery lasts forever.  It would be nice if the camera had a good battery that was rechargeable.Secondly, I had a hard time easily finding some of the settings that I desired.  It felt a little like finding the needle in the haystack.  I should have practiced more before leaving home.Thirdly, I didn't like the grip on the camera.  I was forever hitting the playback button with my thumb, because that is the natural way to grip this camera.  There is a small pad for your thumb, but its placement just felt unnatural.I also had a hard time getting the flash to work to fill in backlighting, etc.  Also, you need  a VERY steady hand when shooting.Now that I am home, the photo quality seems to be pretty good - at least much better than anything you can get with the cell phone.  So I think I'll keep it.  It is lightweight, small, takes fairly good photos, and looks cool, too.

Reviews.Title: So depressed but then......
Reviews.Author: K. Carey "K. Carey"
Reviews.Content: I just had this beautiful camera delivered tonight. I was so excited and it doesn't work. I got the "Battery Exhausted" message with the batteries it came with so in my excitement, I ran to Target to buy 2 packs of Energizer Lithium batteries, a case and a memory card. I get the same message with the new batteries. It doesn't work. I emailed Nikon but I am sure I will have to return it. Funny because I was trying to decide between this one and a Canon version of it. Reckon I picked the wrong one.  I am really missing being out taking nature photos since my old Nikon died 3 wks ago.UPDATE:  returned the camera and promptly received a refund. I ended up buying this same camera from Target and am still getting to know it. So far it seems great.

Reviews.Title: takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: Liz "Grandma Liz"
Reviews.Content: I would have given it 5 stars except for pictures taken of small children or animals.  Just isn't fast enough and I always get a blur.  It has a great zoom as long as there is not fast movement.  But a good camera for the price.  I guess I just need to spend more money if I want a camera that will take pictures of fast movement.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Kerry M
Reviews.Content: I got this for Mother's Day, because I wanted a fancy camera with zoom, but I have no clue how to use those cameras.  This camera has all those bells and whistles that I wanted in a camera and so easy to use.  You can adjust the exposure or just switch it to the exact type of setting you're in, like at a sporting event, or taking a picture of a pet, it's really easy and it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: AWrobel
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera.  The zoom capability is amazing.  Can't wait to use it on our vacation and take just amazing pictures.  This will help capture our memorable vacation forever.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: John Olson
Reviews.Content: It's a great step up from you basic point and shoot and from the L820 that we had purchased earlier.  We stayed with Nikon because of past cameras.  Both of our point and shoots suffered from being dropped and broken battery doors.  Cameras worked fine but you had to hold the battery door shut.  Both the 820 and the 830 came with neck straps so hopefully they'll fare better.The zoom feature works great, the macro mode is great, the low light function works great (you probably will need the flash only in a dark room).Wonderful first camera or as a step up without spending big bucks.

Reviews.Title: Just What We Wanted
Reviews.Author: ZS2014
Reviews.Content: We ordered this as a gift for our son's graduation.  It is a larger camera (not pocket) size...but that was what we were looking for.  It's very easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: great gift
Reviews.Author: Bryan B.
Reviews.Content: my wife loves her camera - the pictures are of high quality and it was easy to use.  This is a bit thicker than the other digital cameras, but we knew that going in.  It fits in her purse and she loves the quality.

Reviews.Title: cool nikon
Reviews.Author: rebecca cappellino
Reviews.Content: great shots, zoom is great, and nice to handle. took pictures of granddaughters prom in front of window no back lighting.  used flash as successed.

Reviews.Title: Affordable and nice features
Reviews.Author: Altaf Mateen
Reviews.Content: Nikon coolpix has some nice desired features and is easy to use. It is attractive and well designed. This camera takes series of photos and processes the best image. Result is vibrant picture. You can use built in differnt scenery mode or let camera decide it for you.What I didn't like about it is that it feels cheap and made of plastic material but Nikon may have done it to make it light in the weight. Flash and battery door pop up seems flimsy and I felt it won't last very many use or break off on slight mishandling. Camera doesn't have a view finder but it makes up with tilt swivel screen in many direction so you can take pictures pointing above your head (if you're in crowd or if bright Sun is blaring in the middle of the day then you can Change screen position up, down or in sides.Your photos would come out darker if you're zooming in far out subject on cloudy day but with 34x zoom you should be using a tripod and taking photo when there is suffrciant light behind you and onto the subject, camera does compensate for shake but that is more effective when you're taking a portrait but when you're zoning in 30 times even a slight hand shake will multiply 30 times.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: AllAboutWords
Reviews.Content: I've owned a few Nikons in the past, and am happy with this easy to use model at a pretty good price.

Reviews.Title: I really do like it...
Reviews.Author: Angela Stevenson
Reviews.Content: I needed a good camera to take photos of prom and other activities that my daughter has and this camera was truly great for that purpose.  Every picture turned out clear and the zoom option was nice although I didn't need it to zoom that close. It takes good pictures, they aren't the great pictures you've seen by really expensive professional cameras but I really can't complain about the clarity of any of my pictures.  They looked better than all of my friends pictures by far and they had way more expensive bulkier camera's than I did. So all in all I am very pleased... However, I really wished I would've done a little more research because I do keep in touch via social media with my family and this would have been a few steps easier to upload pictures had it had built in wifi like the Canon SX510.  By all other reviews they rank these two camera's pretty close and that would've sent me the other way had I done my research better.  I guess if wifi doesn't matter to you then this is your camera!

Reviews.Title: It is a lot better the the previous camera that I bought and sent back to Amazon
Reviews.Author: Henry B. Edwards
Reviews.Content: This camera has all of the features that I was looking for. however, it is an older version.  I wish I had researched a bit more to get the latest, but I had to have a replacement camera quickly.

Reviews.Title: NIKON COOLPIX L830 16 MP CMOS Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Ineke Baker
Reviews.Content: Because of my incredible busy lifestyle, I have not used it a tremendous amount of time.However, so far I am very happy using the new camera.  I will go on vacation in July andwill do my "homework" before - I promise.Ineke Baker-Adan

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Maudeline Nesbitt
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.; love the color.  However, it does not have rechargable batteries which is a big must for me.

Reviews.Title: Donation
Reviews.Author: Cindy Garvey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to donate for a raffle to raise money for life. My bff got this as a christmas gift and rated it very high

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For the Money.
Reviews.Author: Capt Curt "Capt Curt"
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Very happy with it. Not having a view finder sucks, but I shoot with a nice Nikon and that's all I use. Took it out for a test shoot today. Not bad at all. Not even close to a D3, but I wanted a camera to leave in the car all the time. Got it for about $200, and I won't stay awake at night about it being in the car.First Rule in a Gun Fight, Have One.First Rule taking photos With A Camera, Have One.

Reviews.Title: Ooops, I goofed
Reviews.Author: Bob  Deffeyes "Amateur photographer"
Reviews.Content: The camera is fine, but I ordered the wrong thing.I wanted to replace my Coolpix P100 that is a GREAT camera.After thousands of photos, it is ready for retirement.  In looking at the specs on the L830, it looked like just the right thing to replace the P100.  Unfortunately I thought it was a viewfinder camera and it is not. We took it on vacation and then found you have to look at the monitor on the back to frame the shot. Two problems. (1) my eyesight makes it difficult to manage. In particular in bright sunlight I could not see the picture well enough for precise cpmpositions. Flying bird photos just did not work well at all. (2) holding the camera still enough for low light photos at long telephoto settings was a problem. I guess after 65 years of using viewfinder cameras, I just did not adjust to having to look at the monitor. Maybe you can't teach an old dog new tricks.

Reviews.Title: NIKON COOLPIX L830 16 MP CMOS Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Ineke Baker
Reviews.Content: Because of my incredible busy lifestyle, I have not used it a tremendous amount of time.However, so far I am very happy using the new camera.  I will go on vacation in July andwill do my "homework" before - I promise.Ineke Baker-Adan

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L830 Diugital Camera
Reviews.Author: First Assembly of God
Reviews.Content: When using zoom it doesn't take clear pics right off.  Most of them are blurry.  Video clips don't always load to my media player.I am still learning how to use it so I will have to give it a little more time.  Overall I think ii is a fine camera.

Reviews.Title: Happy wife,happy life
Reviews.Author: Richard Beschorner,Jr
Reviews.Content: Can't rate higher than 4 stars because I haven't used this camera.I bought it for my wife as a gift,and she likes it so it was an excellent buy!Happy wife,happy life.

Reviews.Title: New Camera
Reviews.Author: Janis R. Mann
Reviews.Content: I haven't actually used it yet, but it's a Nikon, need I say more? Love the red color and the size. But I am sure I will love using it.

ProductInfo.Features:
34x optical zoom plus an astounding 68x Dynamic Fine Zoom
Comfortable design, elegantly simple controls and intuitive menu system
3.0-inch 921,000-dot LCD display
Full HD 1080p videos with stereo sound for dazzling movies
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon COOLPIX L830 16 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 34x Zoom NIKKOR Lens and Full 1080p HD Video (Black)
